presentation.fsa
Class FSAGraph

java.lang.Object
  presentation.fsa.GraphElement
      presentation.fsa.FSAGraph
All Implemented Interfaces:
FSASubscriber, PresentationElement
public class FSAGraph
extends GraphElement
implements FSASubscriber

A recursive structure used to view, draw and modify the graph representation of an Automaton. Given a point or rectangular area, computes intersections with graph elements. Observes and updates the Automaton. Updates the graphical visualization metadata and synchronizes it with the Automaton model. Is observed and updated by the GraphView and GraphDrawingView.

Author:
Helen Bretzke, Lenko Grigorov

Method Detail

buildIntersectionDS

private void buildIntersectionDS()
Builds the data structure used to compute the intersection of a point or rectangle with elements of the graph. TODO Reimplement this as a quad tree. Currently uses a bunch of maps to store each element type. Note that the order in which these maps are checked within the intesection methods is important.

wrapTransitions

public void wrapTransitions(java.util.Set<FSATransition> ts)
Creates a new edge between the nodes which correspond to the states between which is the first transition in the provided set. All transitions from the set are wrapped by the edge.

Parameters:
ts - the set of transitions to be wrapped

getBounds

public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds(boolean initAtZeroZero)
Calculates the size of the bounding box necessary for the entire graph. Visits every node, edge and label and uses the union of their bounds to create the box.

Parameters:
initAtZeroZero - Whether you want the box to begin at (0, 0) (true) or tightly bound around the graph (false)
Returns:
Rectangle The bounding box for the graph
